title.narrative: Integrated Lifesaving treatment and prevention of acute malnutrition among children under five and pregnant and lactating women in Hargeisa IDPs and Gebiley district of Waqooyi Galbeed Regions

description.narrative:
The nutrition situation in Waqooyi Galbeed Gabiley district continues to be serious and may deteriorate further without humanitarian assistance. Past deyr 2017 FSNAU reports indicated that Woqooyi Galbeed region has high caseloads of acute malnourished children, with estimated caseloads of 15,860. From the total caseloads estimated in Woqooyi Gelbeed , 3520 were severely malnourished with higher risk of medical complications and death. Despite high cases of children with acute malnutrition in this area, access to life saving nutrition services were very limited with just 23% in Woqooyi Galbeed reported access to nutrition services. To address this situation, Save the Children will improve access and provide nutrition services to children aged 0 to 59 months and Pregnant and Lactating Women (PLW) with acute malnutrition through detection, treatment and referral of complicated cases to the stabilization centers. Priority activities will include: Training of Community Volunteers in the identification and referral of malnutrition cases, and mothers trained in mother-led MUAC to enlarge coverage with close monitoring from Save the Children to prevent wrong referrals and ensure quality of the screening and understanding of the community Provision of Outpatient Therapeutic Feeding (OTP) services for children aged 6-59 months with Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) and Targeted Supplementary Feeding Program (TSFP) for Moderately Acute Malnourished children (MAM) and PLW through mobile outreach teams reaching 23 sites 3 MCHN and 20 mobile sites with integrated OTP/TSFP/IYCF programs. The teams will refer children aged 0-59 months identified with SAM coupled with medical complication, and SAM infants aged under 6 months with or without medical complications to the nearest stabilization center (Borama or Hargeisa). The proposed nutrition project is mainly targeting Hargeisa IDPs and Gabiley district of the Woqooyi Galbeed which are areas mostly affected and displaced by the drought in Somaliland. This project also promotes and supports optimal Infant and Young Child Feeding practices through the screening of breastfeeding difficulties amongst mothers of children under two years of age, provision of one to one counselling for mothers and caretakers with difficulties with regards to Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) practices and raising awareness of caregivers and relatives on the importance of appropriate IYCF.
At the end of the project, the project will reach directly a total of 4,865 (1,829 Boys, 1,830 Girls and 1,206 PLW) children and women with acute malnutrition. In addition, a total of 23,165 (Female 21,776, Men 1,389) will be reached with key IYCF messages in the targeted area. Another 3,245 individuals will also be targeted through trainings and capacity development.
